name: Artillery Duel Network
description:
This is an "online" version of Artillery Duel written to demonstrate the potential of multiplayer games over the Internet with the Commodore 64. It's believed to be the very first Internet-enabled game for the good old C64!

Overview Presentation

Features:

  • Two players over the Internet or LAN (turn-based)
  • Chat (F7)
  • Mediocre graphics
  • Sound effects
  • Joystick control (Port 2)

Technical Details:

  • UDP-based communication (don't forget to forward port 3000 in your router/firewall)
  • Written in DASM assembler
  • Uses netlib64, which in turn supports the RR-Net or ETH64 cartridges.

Check out the GitHub Repository for Credits and more Technical details here.
